result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. BRANDON M FUSEK

records.addlTxt: Scheduling Order

NOT ON THE RECORD 

Defendant BRANDON M FUSEK in court.  Attorney Scott A Ceman in court for BRANDON M FUSEK.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Ceman states he does not represent the defendant on 2022CM122 and has provided the offer to him, and requests the felony be scheduled for final pretrial. Court sets 2022CF78 for Status Hearing on November 8, 2022 at 2:00 PM and all motions and witness lists to be filed the day before. 2022CM122 is to track.
Pre-Trial Status Report

ADDRESS INFO for BRANDON M FUSEK
Current: 221 W. Front St, Marquette, WI 53947 United States  (Effective: 07-13-2022)
Prior: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States
H.F.
Return date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 am.

10:02 AM Defendant BRANDON M FUSEK in court, in custody.  Attorney Scott Ceman present with the defendant as a special appearance. Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls 2022CF78 & 2022CM122: 2022CM122-Atty Ceman confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. Court finds probable cause. Atty Ceman enters a plea of NOT GUILTY on behalf of the defendant. DA makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond.

2022CF78 - Atty Ceman states the defendant will waive the preliminary hearing. Defendant concurs. Court instructs the defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary examination. Defendant waives his/her right to a preliminary examination. Court finds probable cause. Court accepts the waiver of the prelim and binds the defendant over for trial. 

State files an information with the court, same as the criminal complaint. Attorney Ceman acknowledges receipt of the information and waives any reading. Atty Ceman enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant. 

Court sets both cases for Return Date on September 12, 2022 at 10:30 AM

Court adjourned at 10:06 AM
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney
Preliminary Hearing - Schedule or Waiver on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

No Violent Contact with the victim. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
Consent and Order for Substitution of Attorney

Request to Amend No Contact Order (Christine Ann Center)

11:23 AM Defendant BRANDON M FUSEK in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for BRANDON M FUSEK. Statement by Atty Kapelis regarding bond modification. Statement by the victim regarding bond. Victim did go to the Christine Ann Center. DA Laspisa makes statement regarding bond - objects. Court will amend bond to No Violent Contact once the letter from the Christine Ann Center is filed. All other conditions to remain the same. 

Court adjourned at 11:26 AM.

Second appearance on May 31, 2022 at 10:00 am.

10:33 AM Defendant BRANDON M FUSEK in court, in custody.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Michael J Kapelis in court for BRANDON M FUSEK. Atty Kapelis states defendant would like to hire his own attorney and requests an adjourned preliminary hearing date. Defendant waives the time limits. Court sets status of counsel for May 31, 2022 at 10:00 AM.

Court adjourned at 10:34 AM.
records.descr: Waiver of time limits for preliminary hearing

records.addlTxt: (Atty Michael Kapelis)
Bail Bond Deposit Acknowledgement
Preliminary hearing on April 26, 2022 at 10:30 am.

ADDRESS INFO for BRANDON M FUSEK
Current: 571 Cty Rd A, C/O Green Lake County Jail, Green Lake, WI 54941 United States  (Effective: 04-19-2022)
Prior: 328 Broadway St, Berlin, WI 54923

No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.
**PROCESSING COMPLETE**

No Contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department.

1:20 PM Defendant BRANDON M FUSEK appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Michael Kapelis appeared by video for BRANDON M FUSEK.  Attorney Gerise Marie Laspisa in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant  has no objection to holding this hearing by zoom. Atty Kapelis confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading and requests a preliminary hearing. Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count. DA Laspisa makes bond recommendation. DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights. Attorney Michael Kapelis makes bond recommendation. Court sets bond at $2,500 cash bond and conditions of: No contact with the victim or the victim's residence. Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision. Defendant may go to the residence of the victim one time to obtain personal property that is needed for a few days (clothes, hygiene, medication, etc), but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer. Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  You may be randomly tested for compliance. Defendant is to complete processing with the Green Lake County Sheriff's Department. Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing. Defendant does not waive the time limits. Court will set for Preliminary Hearing for April 26, 2022 at 10:30 AM.

Court adjourned at 1:25 PM.
**PROCESSING NEEDED**
